p: We also compared the trend of COVID-19 research with that of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003 (see Supplementary material, Appendix S1 and Fig. S2). The patterns of COVID-19 research subjects were generally comparable with those in SARS ( Fig. 1a,b). The temporal trends in both diseases generally agreed with the way we gain knowledge on novel diseases, and also reflected accessibility of resources to researchers in different disciplines.
